recipe_long_name: Baghaar Sanwa Millet Fasting Recipe recipe - How to make Baghaar Sanwa Millet Fasting Recipe
recipe_ing:
100 gms sanwa millet (sama) , also called baghaar
 100 gms jaggery (gur)
 a pinch of salt
 1 tbsp ghee
 2 cardamoms
 2 cups water
recipe:
Method
Roast baghaar in a cooker for atleast 5 minutes on a low flame.
Now add all the water and bring it to a boil.
Add ghee, jaggery, crushed cardamoms and salt. Bring to a boil and close the cooker.
After 2 whistles, lower the flame and keep for 5 min.
The baghaar is ready to serve.
tags: Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sabudana Khichhdi recipe - How to make Sabudana Khichhdi
recipe_ing:
Sabudana - 2 cups
Peanuts - 1/2 cup
Boiled Potatoes-3
Green Chillies -2
recipe:
Take sabudana and soak them in water for sometime. the sabudana should not be soaked for long as there are chances of forming lumps. so to avoid this, check that they are not very soft not to hard. strain the water and take out in muslin cloth and spread the sabudanas on the cloth for sometime till the cloth absorbs the  whole of water. on the othe
Take a serving bowl, add sabudanas, crushed peanuts, potatoes cut into small portions, green chillies and coriander leaves. mix well and  is ready to eat.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Mahashivaratri
Navratri Vrat
times: Total Time: 0 mins , Preparation Time: 20 Minutes   Cooking Time: 10 mts

recipe_long_name: Shabudhana Kichidi recipe - How to make Shabudhana Kichidi
recipe_ing:
1/2 cup green peas
 2 tbsp oil
 2 red chillies
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tsp ginger (adrak) paste
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp sugar
 salt to taste
recipe:
Fry the shabudhana in a pan with no oil for 2 minutes and keep aside. 
Boil the moong dhaal until cooked and keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan.
Add the bay leaves, red chillis, jeera, green chillis and ginger paste. 
Add the vegetables and fry for 2 minutes.
Add 1/2 cup of water and cook until the vegetables are 3/4 cooked.
Add the haldi, jeera, dhania powders, salt and sugar. 
Add the shabudhana and dhaal and cook until the veges and shabu are cooked. 
Garnish with coriander leaves.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
collection of khichdi recipes
times: Preparation Time: 10, Cooking Time: 10, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Soya Bean na Khakhra recipe - How to make Soya Bean na Khakhra
recipe_ing:
500 grams soyabean flour
2 cup soya milk
salt to taste
50 grams wheat flour
recipe:
Mix both flours and salt
Pour 2cup soya milk or only water.
Make a dough like rotli(chapati)
Keep the dough for 30 minutes
Mix dough very well with little oil
Roll thin rotli with the help of little wheat flour
Then roast it with the help of wooden dato on mediam  slow flame. 
One by one you have to do this.
tags:

Low Cal Breakfast
Breakfast Khakhras
Breakfast Theplas, Parathas
Soya Snacks, Starters

Tava

recipe_long_name: Basen Nu Shak recipe - How to make Basen Nu Shak
recipe_ing:
To Be Blended Into A Smooth Paste:
 1/4 cup garlic (lehsun)
 1 tbsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tbsp coriander (dhania) powder
 2 tbsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
 water as needed
 Other Ingredients:
 1 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 salt to taste
 a pinch of turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 to 3 cloves (laung / lavang)
 4 tbsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tbsp curry leaves (kadi patta)  (optional)
 1 cup curds (dahi)
recipe:
Method
Combine the besan, turmeric, salt and required water in a deep pan and prepare a smooth paste.
Cook on a slow flame, while stirring constantly, till the besan paste leaves the edges of pan.
Spread on a grease dish, cool and cut it in small square and keep aside.
Heat 4 tbsp oil in a pan and add the mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves and prepared paste and saute for 2 minutes.
Add 1 cup curd and 1 cup of water, mix well and bring the gravy to boil.
Add the besan pieces, mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.
tags: Gujarati Shaak Sabzi
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Soya Samosa  By smitathecook recipe - How to make Soya Samosa  By smitathecook
recipe_ing:
DOUGH:
 1/2 tsp salt
 1/2 cup oil
 3/4 cup water
 SOYA STUFFING:
 1  tin of baked beans
 2 cups  boiled noodles
 3 cups  finely shredded cabbage
 2 cups chopped spring onions
 2 cups grated carrot
 1/2 cup chopped capsicum
 1 tsp soy sauce
 2 tbsp salad oil
 salt to taste
 oil for frying
 2 tbsp chopped green chillies
 2 tbsp chilli sauce
recipe:
Dough
Sieve the flour.
Sprinkle salt.
Mix oil and water in a container.
Make a well in the flour.
Slowly pour the liquid and prepare the dough.
knead properly.
Stuffing
Heat the oil.
Add the onions, capsicums , carrot , salt and cabbage.
Heat , add baked beans and green chillies.
Heat, add noodles and soya sauce.
When slightly dry remove from heat.
Procedure
Divide the dough into small equal portions.
Roll each into a circle, place some stuffing in the centre.
Fold over and press to form a semi circle.
Bring both the corners together and press.
Repeat with the remaining  circles .
Then deep fry in oil till it has a golden tinge.
tags:
Punjabi Swadisht Nashta
Gujarati Farsans
Indian Snacks for Entertaining
Deep-fried Indian Starters
Soya Snacks, Starters
Deep Fry
Indian Party
times: Preparation Time: 30 minutes, Cooking Time: 20 minutes, Total Time: 50 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sabudana Khichadi N Kakadi Salad recipe - How to make Sabudana Khichadi N Kakadi Salad
recipe_ing:
For Sabudana Khichadi::
 4 cups sago (sabudana), soaked in water for 3-4 hrs
 3 green chillies
 3 cups powdered peanuts
 salt to taste
 1 tsp sugar
 coriander (dhania) leaves
 cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tbsp ghee
 For Kakdi Raita ::
 1  big sized or 2 small sized cucumbers
 1 cup curds (dahi)
 1 tbsp sugar
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp oil
 mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 coriander (dhania) leaves
recipe:
For sabudana khichadi:
Heat ghee in a pan , add cumin seeds .. when seeds turn brown add green chillies keep for a min .
In a bowl , mix soaked sabudana , mungfali powder, salt and sugar , mix it well..
Add this mixture to the pan , mix well. steam
For 5-10 min till the sabudana is done.
Now garnish with coriendor seeds.
For kakdi raita:
Grate the cucumber . add curd , sugar, salt .
In a small pan heat oil, add mustard seeds.
When the seeds splutter , add this oil to cucumber n mix well .
Garnish with coriendor leave .
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
collection of khichdi recipes
Mahashivaratri
Navratri Vrat
times: Preparation Time: 15 min, Cooking Time: 15 min, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_ing:
1 cup curds (dahi)
1/4 cup peanuts[roasted and crushed]
cilli-ginger paste
2 tbsp sugar
recipe:
Mix all the above ingredien
Serve it with hot sabudana vadas.

recipe_long_name: Makai Mohanthal recipe - How to make Makai Mohanthal
recipe_ing:
1 kg corn (makai ke dane)  (fresh)
 200 gms mava (khoya)
 5 gms cardamoms
 4 to 5 saffron (kesar) strands
 500 gms sugar
 5 gms almonds (badam)
 5 gms pistachios
 1/2 nutmeg (jaiphal)
 250 gms white butter  (homemade)
recipe:
Method
Blend the corn in a mixer into a smooth paste. Keep aide.
Heat the butter in a pan, add the corn and saute for 10 minutes.
Add the khoya and nuts, mix well and saute till the khoya tuns golden brown.
Prepare sugar syrup of 2 strings consistency using the sugar and add the prepared corn mixture to the syrup and mix well.
Add the cardamom powder, nutmeg and saffron and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Transfer the mixture into a greased plate and cool.
Cut into desired pieces and store refrigerated or serve immediately.
tags: Gujarati Sweet Mithai
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 40 mins, Total Time: 1 hours,

recipe_long_name: Toasted Stuffed Dhokla: recipe - How to make Toasted Stuffed Dhokla:
recipe_ing:
FOR THE DHOKLA::
 2 cups white dhokla flour (readily available in local shops)
 1 1/2 cups  sour buttermilk
 1 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp soda
 2 tsp oil
 3 to 4 tbsp  slightly warm water
 FOR THE STUFFING::
 1/2 to3/4 cup Green Chutney prepared adding mint leaves
 1 cup boiled mixed vegetables
 1  small capsicum chopped well
 salt to taste
recipe:
for the dhokla:
Mix butter milk and water to the dhokla flour and allow to ferment for 8-10 hours.
Mix in salt  and chilli ginger paste to the batter.
Add soda mixed with 2 tsp oil.
Mix well and whip well for a minute.
Prepare 1/2 inch thick dhokla in a 8 inch lightly greased thali(with oil).
When cool trim the sides and divide into 4 parts.
Cut into sizes of bread slices.
For the stuffing:
Mix green chutney,boiled vegetables,chopped capsicum and salt as needed.
Assembling:
Spread the filling on 1 slice and cover with another slice.
Brush a little ghee on the outer sides and toast in a sandwich toaster till light brown.
Serve hot with chilled dahi.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Breakfast Dhokla
Steam
Steamer
times: Preparation Time: 20-25 mins, Cooking Time: 15-20 mins, Total Time: 45 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sabudana Shira recipe - How to make Sabudana Shira
recipe_ing:
100 gms sago (sabudana)
 100 gms powdered almonds (badam)
 2 tbsp ghee
 100 gms sugar
 250 ml milk
 cardamom (elaichi) powder
recipe:
Grind sabudana in a mixi
Put ghee in a kadai roast sabudana powder and almond powder till it is slightly pink in colour add milk
When milk is soaked up add sugar keep on stirring till it leaves the kadai garnish with elachi powder
tags:

recipe_long_name: Masoor Bhaat recipe - How to make Masoor Bhaat
recipe_ing:
250 gms soaked masoor (whole red lentil)
 250 gms rice (chawal)
 250 gms tomatoes
 200 gms onions
 2 tsp ginger-garlic (adrak-lehsun) paste
 1 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tsp chilli powder
 2 tsp garam masala
 2 bayleaf (tejpatta)
 2 cloves (laung / lavang)
 4 to 5 curry leaves (kadi patta)
recipe:
Method
Boil the rice in a deep pan in enough water till cooked.
Keep aside.
Heat the oil in pan and add the bayleaf, cloves, red chilli and curry leaves and saute for 10 seconds.
Add the onions and saute till they turn golden brown.
Add the tomatoes, turmeric powder, chilli powder, salt and garam masala, mix well and saute till the tomatoes turn soft and are pureed.
Add the massor and enough water, mix well and cook till the rice and masoor are cooked.
Serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Hariyali Chhaas ( Fresh Buttermilk) recipe - How to make Hariyali Chhaas ( Fresh Buttermilk)
recipe_ing:
1 ltr plain buttermilk
 2 tsp chopped mint leaves (phudina) leaves
 2 tsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 2 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 of ginger (adrak)
 1 pinch of roasted cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 salt to taste
 salted boondi for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Take the plain buttermilk in a deep pan.
Crush the mint, curry leaves and coriander leaves lightly and add to the buttermilk and mix well.
Add the crushed ginger, roasted cumin seeds powder and salt and whisk well.
Keep aside for 10 minutes.
Strain and serve chilled, garnished with salted boondi.
tags: Gujarati  Drinks
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sabu Dana Wada recipe - How to make Sabu Dana Wada
recipe_ing:
250 gms sago (sabudana)
 200 gms potatoes
 2 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 50 gms cinnamon (dalchini)
 lemon juice to taste
 salt to taste
 1 tsp pepper powder
 1/2 ltr oil
recipe:
Wash sabu dana and keep it aside fr it to get soaked for 15 mins,
Thn remove all water.
Mix it with mashed boiled potatos,
thn mix all the specified ingredients and make oval flat balls.
take oil to fry in a pan, then heat it,
And fry the balls till golden brown color comes.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Mahashivaratri
Navratri Vrat
times: Preparation Time: 20 minutes, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Cooked Rice Chapathi recipe - How to make Cooked Rice Chapathi
recipe_ing:
1 cup cooked rice (chawal)
 1 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1 tsp ginger (adrak) paste
 1 tsp green chilli paste
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp oil
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients, except the oil and knead into a soft dough, using water only if required.
Divide the dough into 4 equal portions and roll out into a circle of 4" diameter.
Heat a tava and cook the rotis using little oil till golden brown spots appear on both the sides.
Serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Roti, Thepla recipe collection
Indian Rotis
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Rainy Raita recipe - How to make Rainy Raita
recipe_ing:
1/2 cup finely chopped cucumber
 1/2 cup finely chopped spring onions whites and green
 1/4 cup freshly grated coconut
 1 tbsp chopped canned pineapple
 2 tsp canned pineapple syrup
 1 cup thick beaten curds (dahi)
 2 tsp finely chopped green chillies
 1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tsp grated ginger (adrak)
 salt to taste
 For Garnish:
 2 tsp roasted cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 2 tsp red chilli powder
 1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Combine the curds and the remaining ingredients in a bowl and mix well and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Just before serving, sprinkle the cumin seeds and chilli powder and garnish with coriander.
Serve chilled with hot bhajiyas.
tags:
Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
Raitas
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Leela Nariyal ni Bhakarvadi recipe - How to make Leela Nariyal ni Bhakarvadi
recipe_ing:
For The Stuffing:
 400 gms freshly grated coconut
 3 to 4 tbsp besan (bengal gram flour)
 2 tsp oil
 1 1/2 tsp dried mango powder (amchur)
 1 tsp coriander-cumin seeds (dhania-jeera) powder
 2 tbsp sesame seeds (til)
 2 tbsp fennel seeds (saunf)
 2 tbsp chilli powder
 1 tbsp garam masala
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp powdered sugar
 For The Dough:
 2 cups plain flour (maida)
 salt to taste
 3 tbsp oil
 Other Ingredients:
 oil for deep frying
recipe:
For the stuffing
Heat a pan and put the grated fresh coconut and dry roast till light pink and keep aside.
Heat 2 tsp oil in same pan and add the besan and saute till it turns pink in colour.
Add the fried coconut and mix well and transfer to a bowl and keep aside to cool.
Add the amchur, garam masala, chilli powder, salt, sugar , sesame seeds, fennel seeds, coriander-cumin seeds powder and mix well and keep aside.
For the dough:
Combine all the ingredients and knead into a medium soft dough using enough water.
How to proceed
Divide the dough into small equal portions and shape them
Spread the prepared stuffing to make a thin layer on the roti.
Press the stuffing on to the roti with light hands so that the stuffing sticks to the roti well.
Now roll this roti like swiss rolls and cut it to 1" size.
Press the edges well and keep aside,
Similarly prepare remaining kachoris using remaining dough and stuffing.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the kachoris till golden brown and serve in drizzling rains with hot tea or coffee.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Deep-fried Indian Starters
Indian Jar Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 25 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Chapati Poha recipe - How to make Chapati Poha
recipe_ing:
5 left over chapatis
 1 tsp oil
 2 medium onions , sliced
 5  chopped green chillies
 4 to 5 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 3 cups shredded cabbage
 1 cup green peas
 1 cup carrot , chopped
 1/2 cup peanuts
 1 capsicum , cut lenght wise
 1/2 tsp green chilli sauce
 1/4 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
recipe:
Method
Cut the chapatis in to small pieces using hands and keep aside.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, add the mustard seeds.
when the seeds crackle, add the onions, green chilles and curry leaves and saute for couple of minutes.
Add the vegetables and saute till veggies are half cooked.
Add the chapatis and saute for 5 minutes.
Add the groundnuts and saute for 2 minutes.
ADd the chilli sauce and mix well.
Add the coriander and mix well.
Serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati  Dry Snacks
Breakfast using Leftovers
Breakfast Upma, Poha
Stir-fry
High Tea Party
Non Stick Kadai Veg
times: Preparation Time: 30  mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 50 mins ,

recipe_name: Vaghareli Galka- Khichadi ( Ridge Gourd Khichdi)
recipe_long_name: Vaghareli Galka- Khichadi ( Ridge Gourd Khichdi) recipe - How to make Vaghareli Galka- Khichadi ( Ridge Gourd Khichdi)
recipe_ing:
2 cups chopped ridge gourd (turai)
 1/2 onion , chopped
 1/2 potato , chopped
 1/2 tomato , chopped
 1/2 cup chopped french beans
 1/2 carrot , sliced
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 1/2 cup sliced cabbage
 2 green chillies , chopped
 3 cups rice (chawal)
 1/2 cup moong dal (split  green gram)
 For The Tempering:
 1 tbsp oil
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 3 to 4 peppercorns (kalimirch)
 3 to 4 cloves (laung / lavang)
 2 tbsp chopped garlic (lehsun)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Clean, wash and drain the dal and rice with enough water.
Heat the oil in a pressure cooker and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the garlic and saute till garlic turns golden brown.
Add the pepper, bay leaf, cloves and saute for 20 seconds.
Add the asafoetida and saute for 10 seconds.
Add the vegetables and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the turmeric powder, chilli powder and salt and mix well.
Add the rice and dal and mix well and add 6-8 cups water and mix well.
Pressure cook for 2 whistles or till cooked.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Serve hot.
tags: Gujarati Khichdi
times: Preparation Time: 30 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 50 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Apricot and Kesar Kheer recipe - How to make Apricot and Kesar Kheer
recipe_ing:
1 cup over cooked rice (chawal)
 1/2 cup apricots puree
 2 tbsp finely chopped apricots
 4 tbsp powdered sugar
 2 tsp chirongi nuts (charoli)
 1/2 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 2 tsp saffron (kesar) strands
 2 cups milk
recipe:
Method
Heat milk in a deep pan, add the rice, sugar, charoli, kesar, cardamom powder and boil for a minute on a slow flame.
Add the apricot pulp and pieces, mix well and simmer for half a minute.
Garnish it with pistachios and serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Collection of Kheer
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Onion and Sev Raita recipe - How to make Onion and Sev Raita
recipe_ing:
1 cup sev
 2 cups curds (dahi)
 salt to taste
 1/2 cup finely chopped onions
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients in deep bowl and whisk well.
Serve it fresh with hot theplas.
tags: Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_name: Chuada Muthiya Nu Shaak ( Cowpeas and Muthiya Veg)
recipe_long_name: Chuada Muthiya Nu Shaak ( Cowpeas and Muthiya Veg) recipe - How to make Chuada Muthiya Nu Shaak ( Cowpeas and Muthiya Veg)
recipe_ing:
For The Muthiyas:
 1 cup grated bottle gourd (doodhi / lauki)
 1/2 cup jowar (white millet) flour
 1/2 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1 tbsp coriander (dhania) seeds powder
 2 tsp chilli powder
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tsp powdered cumin seeds (jeera)
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp oil
 1 tsp cooking soda
 2 tbsp curds (dahi)
 2 tsp sugar
 Other Ingredients:
 2 cups soaked and boiled chawli (cow pea / lobhia)
 1 tbsp ghee
 2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 a few curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1/2 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
 salt to taste
 2 tsp coriander (dhania) seeds powder
 2 tsp chilli powder
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tbsp jaggery (gur)
 4 kokum
 For The Garnish:
 2 tbsp fried cashewnuts (kaju)
recipe:
for the muthiyas
Combine all the ingredients.
Add little water if required and knead a semi soft dough. Make 5" long and 1/2" thick rolls and steam it in a steamer for 15 minutes.
Cool and cut into round slices of 1/2 " thickness.
Keep aside.
how to proceed
Heat ghee in kadhai and add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the carom seeds and curry leaves and saute for 30 seconds.
ADd the boiled cowpeas and remaining ingredients and mix well.
Add 3/4 cup water, mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the muthiyas and simmer for 1 minutes.
Serve hot.
tags:
Gujarati Kathols
Jain Subzi / Gravies
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Stuffed Thepla recipe - How to make Stuffed Thepla
recipe_ing:
For The Thepla:
 2 cups whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1/2 cup chopped fenugreek (methi) leaves
 1 tbsp coriander (dhania) seeds powder
 2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp oil
 1 tsp powdered sugar
 For The Stuffing:
 1/2 cup boiled and mashed potatoes
 2 tsp oil
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
recipe:
For the stuffing
 For the stuffing
Heat oil in a pan and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the turmeric powder and potatoes along with salt, mix well and saute for 1 minute.
Remove from the flame and keep aside.
For the theplas
Combine all the ingredients in a deep bowl and knead a semi soft dough.
Make 2" puris.
Fill each with the above filling.
Gather the sides and seal the filling in the center.
Press it well and roll again to 5" diameter circle.
Heat tava and roast the stuffed thepla with oil.
Serve fresh and hot with curds or pickle.
tags:
Gujarati Roti, Thepla recipe collection
Gujarati One Dish Meal
Breakfast Theplas, Parathas
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Miini Faraali Rajgira Pizzas recipe - How to make Miini Faraali Rajgira Pizzas
recipe_ing:
1 1/2 cups rajgira flour
 1/2 cup waterchestnut (shingoda) flour
 salt to taste
 1 tsp freshly ground black pepper powder
 1 tsp roasted sesame seeds (til)
 1 potato , boiled and mashed
 oil for cooking
 For The Topping:
 1 cup paneer (cottage cheese) , mashed  ( homemade )
 2 tsp castor sugar
 1 cup chopped mixed fruits
 1 tbsp chopped mixed nuts
 3 tsp pineapple jam
 For The Garnish –:
 chopped coriander (dhania)
 chopped mint leaves (phudina) leaves
recipe:
Method
In a bowl, combine the rajgira and water-chestnut flour.  Add the potato,salt, pepper powder,sesame seeds,oil, mix well and knead well to soft dough.
Roll puris out of the dogh.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry till they turn golden brown/
Drain on an absorbent paper and keep aside.
In another bowl, combine the paneer, castor sugar,nuts properly and add the jam and mixed fruits.
Apply this topping on each puris.
While serving garnish with coriander and mint.
This is an usual pizza which everyone likes it.
tags: Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,
